Ad Text:
At TL Consulting, we simplify modern complexity with advanced, sustainable engineering. As a proudly Australian-owned consultancy with over 15 years of experience, we empower businesses to innovate and achieve measurable outcomes through scalable, cloud-native solutions. Our 50+ consultants operate across key sectors including banking, financial services & insurance (BFSI), government, retail, education, and entertainment. This cross-industry expertise allows us to deliver customer-centric solutions that combine deep technical capability with a clear understanding of each client’s strategic vision. Our approach leverages proven, scalable blueprints tailored to your business direction—enabling accelerated outcomes, maximized ROI, and sustainable long-term adoption.

We maintain strategic partnerships with organizations that share our vision for a cloud-native future. Through our collaborations with Microsoft, GitHub, and Databricks, we ensure our capabilities stay aligned with evolving best practices. These partnerships also provide access to innovation programs, co-funding opportunities, and dedicated support—helping us accelerate time-to-value for our clients.

About the role

As the Data Solutions Architect, you will spearhead the development, growth, and strategic direction of the data engineering practice within our consultancy. Your role will focus on leading a team of data professionals, managing client engagements, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality, data-driven solutions that address client challenges. You will work closely with both internal teams and clients to help organizations leverage data for better decision-making, innovation, and growth.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Practice Leadership & Development:

Define the strategic roadmap for the data engineering practice, aligning it with overall company goals.

Identify emerging trends, technologies, and opportunities to continuously evolve the practice.

Lead and orchestrate innovation initiatives aiming to mature the organisation’s data capabilities and solutions.

Develop service offerings that meet client needs, including data strategy, BI, Artificial Intelligence, advanced analytics, and data governance.

Foster a culture of innovation and continuous learning within the team.

Client Engagement & Solution Delivery:

Lead high-impact client engagements, guiding teams in the delivery of end-to-end data analytics solutions.

Provide expertise in the areas of data strategy, business intelligence, predictive analytics, and data management.

Collaborate with clients to understand business objectives and design tailored data-driven solutions.

Ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and meet quality standards.

Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients to ensure repeat business.

Team Leadership & Development:

Manage and mentor a team of data engineers and analysts, promoting collaboration and career growth.

Recruit, retain, and develop talent within the data engineering team.

Conduct regular performance reviews and provide feedback to enhance team capabilities.

Foster a collaborative environment that encourages innovation and best practices.

Business Development & Sales Support:

Support business development efforts by working closely with the sales team to identify and pursue new opportunities.

Lead and contribute to proposal writing, client presentations, and pre-sales activities.

Act as a subject matter expert (SME) during client discussions, showcasing the value of data solutions in tackling business problems.

Identify potential partnerships and collaborations that can enhance the practice’s offerings.

Thought Leadership:

Serve as the face of the data engineering practice in industry forums, conferences, and events.

Publish white papers, blogs, and case studies to showcase the consultancy’s capabilities and success stories.

Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging tools, and methodologies, sharing insights with clients and internal teams.


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

Required Skills and Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. Master’s degree or MBA preferred.

Experience:

10+ years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or related data domains.

5+ years of experience in a consulting or professional services environment.

Proven experience in leading data engineering teams and delivering client-focused solutions.

Technical Skills:

Expertise in data analytics tools and platforms (e.g., SQL, Python, R, Apache Spark, Tableau, Power BI).

Expertise in Azure services and analytics platforms such as Databricks, Synapse and MS Fabric.

Knowledge of other cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud) is a plus.

Familiar with DMBOK and/or TOGAF frameworks.

Expertise with data lake modelling such as Kimball (Star Schema) and Data Vault modelling.

Strong understanding of machine learning, predictive analytics, and data visualization techniques.

Soft Skills:

Strong clients focus and ensure effective relationships are in place with key client stakeholders to deliver that service.

Excellent client relationship management skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Strong stakeholder management skills interfacing with diverse stakeholders. i.e., General Manager, Head of Architecture, Solution Architecture.

Solid experience in relationship management, conflict resolution, influencing and negotiation.

Must be able to work independently but also lead Consulting engagements in a highly matrixed environment (especially for short-term engagements).

A team player who can liaise effectively with a diverse group of delivery teams to ensure a positive experience for the customer.

Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

Consulting experience in various industries (e.g., finance, healthcare, manufacturing).

Azure and Databricks certifications are a plus.

Experience with Agile methodologies and project management tools.


WHY JOIN US

Be part of a dynamic consultancy firm that values innovation, growth, and professional development.

Lead a growing practice at the forefront of data-driven business transformation.

Work with diverse, top-tier clients across multiple industries, delivering impactful solutions.

Competitive salary and benefits package.

Career development and growth opportunities within a rapidly expanding organization.




This is a Sydney based, permanent opportunity and will be hybrid in nature. No agencies please. Candidates must have valid visa with full work rights in Australia. Visas will not be transferred or sponsored.

TL Consulting Group understands the importance of fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are committed to ensuring that everyone, no matter their gender, identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, religion, disability, or age, has equal access to opportunities. We warmly welcome applications from all individuals, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, members of the LGBTQI+ community, and individuals with disabilities.

Job Title: Platform Manager - Data & AI - Transformation - Hawthorn East
Ad Text:
We’ve been trusted to serve Aussie communities since 1914 and grown to become a top 30-listed on the ASX with over 115,000 team members and a portfolio of iconic brands. At Coles Group, you’ll not only get to make a difference to millions of Aussie lives—you’ll also get to see your impact.

About the team

As the way we shop continues to evolve, our Data and Artificial Intelligence Team keeps us at the cutting edge. Driven by our innovative, inclusive, and forward-thinking culture, we’re constantly looking at ways to reinvent the shopping experience for our customers and build the next generation of digital retailing. 

The Data and Artificial Intelligence within the broader Coles Technology Team focuses on building data collection and analytics capabilities to uncover customer, product, and operational insights. Providing data driven support to our users and enabling Coles to be a data driven organisation.

About the role

For this exciting position within our Data and Artificial Intelligence team, we are seeking an experienced Platform Manager – Transformation to lead end-to-end planning, execution, and delivery of platform transformation programs ensuring alignment to enterprise Data & AI strategy and business outcomes.

Working closely with the Senior Platform Manager – Transformation, your main responsibilities will include the following but not be limited to the below: 

Drive the adoption of modern cloud infrastructure, containerisation, microservices, Infrastructure as Code and automation frameworks.
Collaborate closely with architecture, security, data governance, and compliance teams to embed standards and controls into the evolving platform.
Manage risks, dependencies, and resources proactively to maintain project momentum and delivery quality.
Facilitate knowledge sharing and cross-team collaboration to accelerate transformation and build organisational capability.
Deliver timely reporting and transparent communication on project status, risks, and opportunities to senior leadership.
Identify opportunities to optimise costs, improve performance, and enhance scalability within the platform environment.
Foster a culture of experimentation, innovation, and accountability within the transformation team.

We are looking for a versatile leader to lead, mentor, and grow a team of platform engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and high performance.

You will inspire and motivate cross-functional teams to embrace change and deliver transformational outcomes aligned with enterprise goals whilst acting as a change agent, promoting Agile methodologies, DevOps practices, and continuous delivery culture throughout transformation initiatives.

Experience required
Proven years of experience in platform management, IT transformation, or technical program management in data and AI environments.
Proven track record delivering complex platform transformation or cloud migration projects.
Working experience with cloud platforms (Azure, Snowflake, Databricks), containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes), and automation tools (Terraform, Ansible).
Familiarity with modern data platform technologies, AI/ML infrastructure, and scalable architecture patterns.
Experience in agile methodologies and cross-functional team leadership.
Understanding of data governance, security, and compliance requirements in large enterprises.

Commercial Skills and Formal Qualifications
Strong project and program management skills with ability to drive delivery in complex environments.
Technical expertise in cloud infrastructure, platform automation, and modernisation frameworks.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
Leadership skills with experience managing technical teams.
Relevant certifications in cloud platforms, project management, or transformation methodologies are advantageous.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

What’s in it for you?
Flexible working options: We know that work is only one part of your life, so we actively encourage a positive work-life balance and provide hybrid working options to help you achieve it.
Office perks: Take advantage of our gym facility and fitness classes, free parking, BBQ area, mini-Coles supermarket, fooderie hub where you can sample new products before they hit the shelves, school holiday program and so much more when you come in.
Discounts: Eligible team members receive 5% discount all year round on your Supermarket and Liquor online and in-store purchases. We also offer additional periods of double discount (10%) at various times throughout the year. As well as hotdeals exclusive to team members that translate into additional savings.
Reward through recognition: Give and receive recognition, linked to our Coles values, through our digital recognition platform ‘mythanks’. You can accumulate points to redeem in the online shop for exciting gifts and electronic gift cards from an extensive range of retailers.
Opportunities for learning and development: No matter where you start within our diverse business, you’ll have experiences, exposure, and education to satisfy you. Discover and explore a variety of career development programs and job-specific training.
Paid parental leave: We understand how important your life outside work is and offer permanent team members paid parental leave to support you in balancing work and family.
Investment in your future: Our annual team member share plan offer allows eligible team members to make regular pre-tax salary sacrifice deductions to purchase Coles Group shares.

About the recruitment process

We’re continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that is just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We are committed to creating a workplace that is safe and respectful for our team. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities.

We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. For further information and additional contact details visit the ‘Our Recruitment Process’ section of our careers site or email inclusionrecruitment@coles.com.au

Job ID: 166720

Employment Type: Full time

Job Title: Business Analyst - Benefits and Digital Initiatives
Ad Text:
SAP Business Analyst 

Brisbane CBD
Hybrid
Competitive Market rate
Local Gov Client
14-Month initial contract

We are seeking an experienced SAP Business Analyst to join a major ERP transformation program focused on digitisation and benefits realisation. This role will lead initiatives that improve business processes and unlock the full potential of SAP S/4HANA and SuccessFactors.
You will work closely with stakeholders to identify blockers to system adoption, design digital solutions, and measure performance improvements. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in SAP S/4HANA implementations, particularly in operational areas such as logistics, warehousing, and workforce planning.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead digitisation initiatives and measure benefits realisation
• Facilitate workshops and collaborate with stakeholders
• Analyse current processes and identify improvement opportunities
• Support change management and solution implementation

Skills and Experience:
• Proven experience with SAP S/4HANA
• Strong understanding of service delivery and operational processes
• Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills
• Experience in government or large-scale transformation programs is desirable

Please reach out to myself on chantelle.lee@peoplebank.com.au / 07 3291 5405 for more information.

Brennan. Where true performance thrives. 
At Brennan, we believe that how technology is delivered is every bit as important as what the technology is. We focus on creating real and relevant value for customers with solutions that fit their specific needs and always reflect their true interests. 
It’s a claim backed by our True Performance System – a way of working engineered to get us closer, and deliver better, for our customers and their actual experience of technology. 
  
Why join Brennan 
True performance for our customers starts with a true belief in our people. 
It’s why we’ve structured our business to help our teams, and their talents, shine bright. It's why we’ve created a workplace where people of all backgrounds, beliefs and experiences are welcomed and empowered. And it’s why we’ve built an organisation where real innovation makes a genuine impact and generates true rewards for our team members. 

True rewards 
In addition to competitive remuneration, Brennan offers extensive benefits, including: 

Training and certification bonuses. 
Culture Awards that recognise excellence. 
Brennan Daredevils – our annual, all-expenses paid trip awarded to our top performers and outstanding contributors.
Vibrant, fun social activities. 
Discounted hardware and software. 
An environment that embraces learning and development.
The role 
As a Senior Data Engineer, you’ll lead the design and technical delivery of data projects, leveraging Microsoft Azure Data Services. 

You’ll work closely with our Data Warehouse, Analytics, and Platform teams, as well as the Project Management Office, to ensure successful end-to-end delivery.

What you will be doing:

This role serves as the lead for data projects, responsible for designing and delivering solutions that meet both new and existing client requirements.
You’ll lead and contribute to projects across a diverse client base, ranging from mid-market to enterprise environments.
Working closely with the Data Architect and key stakeholders, you’ll translate complex data needs into effective, scalable solutions.
You’ll partner with teams across Data & AI, Brennan Digital, and the Project Management Office to ensure seamless and successful client delivery.
What skills and experience you bring:

Strong experience across data engineering with extensive project experience.
Deep and hands-on experience designing, planning and maintaining scalable data infrastructure and data products in complex environments. 
Expertise in some of the following: Data Lake, Synapse, Data Factory, Azure SQL databases.
Implementing data analytics solutions using Microsoft Power BI or Tableau.
Strong SQL/PySpark and data modelling experience.
Previous consulting/systems integrator/managed services (or similar) experience would be beneficial.
Note: As part of our hiring process, you will be required to undertake a National Criminal History Check.

Job Title: Business Analyst - Lead CRM RFP & Discovery Phase
Ad Text:
ABOUT OUR CLIENT   
  
Join a purpose-driven not-for-profit that’s transforming lives across Australia. With a national footprint and a commitment to improving mental health, disability, and community care outcomes, this organisation is embarking on a major CRM transformation. They’re seeking a highly capable Business Analyst to lead the RFP and discovery phase of this strategic program.
  
ABOUT THE ROLE   
  
As the CRM Business Analyst, you’ll take ownership of the organisation’s CRM RFP and vendor evaluation process, ensuring business needs are accurately captured and translated into clear selection criteria. You’ll lead stakeholder workshops, document requirements, and guide the transition from discovery through to implementation planning. Working closely with Procurement, ICT, and UX teams, you’ll ensure the solution design reflects both user needs and strategic objectives.
  
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES   

Lead the CRM RFP and vendor evaluation process, including requirements definition, scoring, and selection support.
Facilitate workshops to capture business needs, map As-Is and To-Be processes, and identify functional and non-functional requirements.
Develop clear business cases and documentation to support procurement and decision-making.
Partner with stakeholders across technology and service delivery to ensure alignment with the broader digital roadmap.
Support implementation readiness and planning once the vendor is selected.
KEY REQUIREMENTS   

5–7+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst across large CRM or ERP projects.
Demonstrated RFP/RFT and vendor evaluation experience — ideally leading CRM selection or migration.
Strong facilitation and stakeholder engagement skills across all organisational levels.
Proven ability to document, analyse, and trace functional and technical requirements.
Understanding of CRM implementation, integrations, and data migration.
Relevant IT, Business, or Project Management qualification.
Applications will be assessed within 5 business days and shortlisted applicants will be notified directly.

Company description:



Deloitte Services Pty Ltd



Job description:



We are seeking an experienced Data Migration Subject Matter Expert (SME) to lead and deliver complex, large-scale data migration projects across diverse industries. This role requires deep technical expertise in data migration methodologies, tools, and cloud strategies, alongside exceptional leadership and project management capabilities. You will drive end-to-end migration initiatives, ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and alignment with business objectives while mentoring teams and refining best practices.  

What will your typical day look like? 

Deloitte Data and AI is changing the way that businesses leverage cloud-native technology to solve the toughest Data and AI challenges faced by our customers! Join us as we continue to expand into a cloud-centric and AI and data driven future, working on some of the largest and most complex projects within AU.

About the team:  

Our AI & Data team is a diverse group of over 500 data specialists across Australia, partnering with clients in both public and private sectors to deliver cutting-edge solutions. We collaborate with leading technology providers such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, Snowflake, and Databricks, ensuring we stay at the forefront of emerging AI and data capabilities. 

Enough about us, let's talk about you.  

You are a tech-savvy problem solver who thrives in a data-driven environment. You bring: 

7+ years (Manager) experience in leading / executing data migration workstreams
Experience in designing, planning and managing data migration and assurances processes from legacy systems to next generation cloud-based platforms (e.g. ERP, CRM, Finance)
Experience in creating key data migration products, including data migration strategies, specification, data governance processes, data profiling & quality processes, testing & reconciliation frameworks
Experience in assessing and identifying data migration impacts across other workstreams within a business transformation program
Experience in data migration patterns (e.g. structured / unstructured)
Experience with data engineering, data quality, data cleansing activities
Experience of different delivery methodologies (Agile, Hybrid Agile, Waterfall) across the project lifecycle (planning, discovery, implementation, go-live)
Provide in-depth expertise in migration data platforms, and other enterprise systems.
Oversee data migration, integration, and testing processes to ensure a smooth transition.
Work with technical teams to address system customisations, configurations, and enhancements.
Managing and developing high performing virtual teams
Managing projects with demonstrated business impact from scoping through deployment
Managing and communicating with a range of diverse stakeholders
Technical skills
Data Engineering / ETL / Data Quality / Data Profiling skills with leading integration tools (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP, Informatica, Talend, Experian)
Experience in working with SQL databases
Cloud Data Management technical solutioning experience.
Experience deploying technical solutions into production environments
Experience with cloud services (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud Platform)
Windows and Linux environments
Knowledge of various integration patterns
SQL and relational databases
Bonus knowledge

Experience in one or more of the following areas:

Experience in or exposure to one or more data management disciplines such as, data governance, MDM, BI, reporting, data lakes, big data, cloud ecosystems
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics, Salesforce, SAP, Workday (in the context of data migration)
AWS / Azure / GCP cloud platform experience
Understanding of latest data landscape & trends
Experience in training & building technical teams
Cloud certifications are highly regarded

You will typically be part of or responsible for leading a data migration workstream on a large client project. You will need a range of skills from interviewing client stakeholders, capturing business problem statements, leading client workshops, designing, building and implementing data migration solutions, and communicating the impact of your results to your clients. As you grow, you will take up more senior level responsibilities across solutions, client relationships and business development, and coaching and mentoring junior members of the team

Performance Expectations:  

As a Manager, your role is to deliver high-quality data migration outcomes, collaborate with clients, and contribute to innovation, aligned with Deloitte's T&T Performance Expectations Framework. Your responsibilities will include: 

Client Delivery & Technical Excellence - Develop AI & Data solutions that drive measurable business outcomes. 
Stakeholder Engagement - Work closely with clients and teams to ensure project success. 
Continuous Learning & Innovation - Stay ahead of emerging AI & Data trends and contribute to Deloitte's knowledge-sharing initiatives. 
Operational Excellence - Follow Quality & Risk Management standards and ensure best practices in project execution. 

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we focus our energy on interesting and impactful work. We're always learning, innovating and setting the standard; making a positive difference to our clients and our society. We put coaching at the heart of what we do, helping our people grow their careers in any direction - whether it be up, moving into something new, or even moving across the world.

We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion. We have a diverse collection of people from different backgrounds, with different experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. What binds us together is a shared commitment to value everyone's perspective and to cultivate inclusion; so that our work environment is a safe space we can all belong.

We prioritise flexibility and choice. At Deloitte, you get trust on Day 1. We know our people get their best work done when they're in control of where and how they work, designing their work week around their client, team and personal commitments

We help you live and work well. To support your personal and professional life, we offer a range of perks and benefits, including retail discounts, wellbeing leave, paid volunteering days, twelve flexible working options, market-leading parental leave and return to work support package.

Next Steps

Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now, we'd love to hear from you

Salary: Up to $1100.00 per day inc Super
Ad Text:
ENMP Business Analyst – Operational Readiness

Fed Gov - aviation sector / 12-month contract
Brisbane Airport + WFH (3 days in office) - free onsite parking
Australian Citizens holding, or eligible to hold, a National Security Clearance
The Enterprise Network Modernisation Program (ENMP) will deliver updates to operational (mission-critical) and corporate networks that will ensure existing systems remain connected to deliver safe, efficient, and effective Air Navigation, aviation rescue, and fire-fighting services. It will also enable future enhancements to support future requirements for CMATS, Remote Service Delivery, and the Flexible Use of Airspace.

As an ENMP Business Analyst, adhering to relevant frameworks, you will be responsible and accountable for liaising with key Stakeholders to lead business analyst activities required to support the successful delivery of IT-enabled projects.

Whilst all ENMP Business Analysts operate within a Community of Practice, and can work across multiple projects in the portfolio, the key current priority is Operational Readiness.

This is a hybrid role with a minimum of three days in the office per week. 

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify, assess, and document readiness gaps across people, process, and technology.
Elicit and document requirements to support the delivery of business-as-usual (BAU) capability at go-live.
Facilitate workshops to validate operational requirements, including SOPs, SLAs, RACI models, and escalation procedures.
Support the development of operational use cases and service scenarios for testing and simulations for rehearsals.
Analyse and map current and future state operational workflows to ensure seamless transition into BAU.
Contribute to the development and validation of business readiness checklists, vendor maturity levels, and success criteria.
Data & Insights

Help define key operational metrics, and reporting needs to enable post-implementation monitoring.
Translate operational KPIs and RTO/RPO into actionable reporting requirements for BAU teams. 
Change & Operational Support

Partner with Change Managers to assess and document operational impacts across business units.
Identify training, communication, and documentation needs to support service handover and ongoing operations.
Track operational readiness activities and their alignment with project milestones and transition gates.
To be successful in this position, it is expected that you will have the following attributes:

Demonstrable experience engaging with geographically diverse project teams
High attention to detail and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
Strong analytical and documentation skills (e.g. BPMN, process modelling, business requirements, functional specs).
Experience supporting ITSM or service transition projects (e.g. ITIL4-aligned initiatives, CMDB/Asset Mgmt., tool transitions).
Familiarity with service management platforms (e.g. ServiceNow) and how they enable operational readiness.
Proven ability to engage stakeholders from frontline teams to executive sponsors.
Experience in environments undergoing digital transformation, new service deployment, or critical cutovers.
Desirable:

Certification in BABOK (or an ability to demonstrate a deep level of understanding in business analysis methodologies)
Proficient working with the Microsoft Office Suite
Demonstrable experience regarding analytical thinking and problem solving.
Eligibility:

Australian Citizens holding, or eligible to hold, a National Security Clearance
Work From Home Policy:

Hybrid (3 days in office) - free onsite parking
Rate:

Up to $1100.00 per day including Super
Apply now.  

For more information, contact Iain on 0411 610 620

About the role…

The Data Delivery Leader will lead the delivery of innovative data products that drive measurable business value across our organisation. This role sits at the intersection of technology and business, requiring someone who can ensuring seamless delivery of various types of technical data products & projects. Responsibilities include:

Lead the end-to-end delivery of data products by defining and executing the product vision, strategy, and roadmap, ensuring high-quality outcomes are technically feasibility, and aligned to strategic priorities
Collaborate with the Data Office team (BAs, Devs, Product) to define and understand functional and technical requirements for data product development
Build and maintain strong relationships with business stakeholders, data consumers, and executive leadership
Facilitate workshops, requirements gathering sessions, and product demonstrations
Lead sprint planning, backlog refinement, and retrospectives
Identify opportunities for process improvement and stay on top of AI & Data technological developments

  

About You:

You’re a strategic and delivery-focused data leader who thrives at the intersection of business and technology. You’ll bring the ability to translate vision into execution and drive measurable business value through innovation and insight. Additionally you will have most of the following:

5+ years’ experience managing complex data projects using agile methodologies
Experience working closely with Technology teams on data pipeline development and optimisation
Proven track record of managing relationships across multiple business units and technical teams up to the Executive level
Appreciation & technical understanding of data modelling, data quality, and modern data stack components
Platform experience with the following:
AWS Cloud Environments & core services
Working knowledge of Databricks & Fivetran for data processing & analytics
CI/CD Pipelines, Streaming & release management processes
Previous experience in Utilities/Energy (Desirable)
Certified Product Owner (CSPO) or equivalent agile certification (Desirable)

 

Why Us?
EnergyAustralia is a place where all employees are genuinely valued, supported, and free to be themselves — because we believe that’s when we’re at our best. We embrace diversity of background, experience, and perspective, and we encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disability, and those from the LGBTQ+ community.

Here’s what you can look forward to:

Employee discounts on electricity and gas, plus savings on major brands and products
20 weeks’ paid parental leave – completely gender-equal
Energise Program – flexible working that’s team-centric, enabling teams to agree and succeed together
Performance recognition and incentive programmes – tailored to different roles and teams to reward great work throughout the year
Supportive leaders and a down-to-earth culture where you can be your authentic self

 

If you’re ready to ‘light the way’ in your career, click ‘Apply’ to submit your confidential application. For any questions, please reach out to Jock Clydesdale, Talent Acquisition Partner @ jock.clydesdale@energyaustralia.com.au

The Company

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a leading insurance organisation recognised among the top five general insurers in Australia and New Zealand.

With a focus on innovation, inclusion, and customer outcomes, this company is reshaping the future of insurance through data-led decisions and people-first leadership. Enjoy modern hybrid working options and a forward-thinking culture that values your growth.

The Role

As a Finance Business Partner, you will play a key role in supporting the strategic and commercial goals of the business. Leading a team of 1–2 analysts, you’ll be responsible for delivering financial insights, performance analysis, and high-impact business support.

Your responsibilities will include:

Acting as a trusted advisor to business units, delivering financial analysis and insights to drive strategic decisions
Presenting financial results to senior leadership, offering recommendations and commentary
Leading the end-to-end budgeting and forecasting process (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)
Supporting board and committee reporting, as well as key external stakeholder reports (e.g. shareholders, rating agencies)
Managing legal entity reporting including transfer pricing and reconciliation
Enhancing FP&A systems and processes, with a focus on reporting automation and self-service through tools like PowerBI
Delivering ad hoc financial modelling and valuation support for strategic initiatives
The Candidate

Experience: CA/CPA (or equivalent) with strong business partnering, FP&A, or commercial finance experience. Insurance industry knowledge and familiarity with AASB 17 are essential.
Leadership: Demonstrated experience leading teams and influencing senior stakeholders.
Technical Skills: Strong financial modelling, analysis, and reporting capabilities with advanced Excel and PowerBI experience.
Personal Attributes: Commercially savvy, driven, confident in stakeholder engagement, and able to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
To learn more, please apply now or send your updated CV to josh@lansonpartners.com.

About the Role

An education company, a client of ICG, is undertaking a large-scale customer data remediation and quality improvement program. We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to identify, quantify, and track data issues across multiple systems, and to design and build dynamic dashboards that support program governance and decision-making.

This role will be central in turning complex data into actionable insight, helping the remediation and assurance teams understand where errors exist, how extensive they are, and how progress toward correction is tracking.

Location: Sydney
Duration: 6 months (with potential to extend)

Key Responsibilities

Analyse large datasets to identify data integrity issues, trends, and error categories.

Quantify the number, type, and location of errors across systems and customer records.

Build and maintain Power BI dashboards to track remediation progress, error volumes, and closure rates.

Develop Excel models to support deeper analysis and scenario forecasting.

Provide regular reporting to governance and assurance teams on data accuracy and performance.

Collaborate with business, IT, and remediation teams to define data requirements and ensure alignment.

Contribute to the development of reconciliation and data validation processes.




Skills & Experience Required

Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills.

Proficiency in Power BI, Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, macros), and ideally SQL.

Strong attention to detail with a focus on data accuracy and completeness.

Experience in dashboard design and performance reporting.

Background in data quality, compliance, or remediation programs preferred.

Ability to communicate insights clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders.




What You’ll Work On

Identifying systemic and student-level data issues.

Building dashboards for remediation tracking and executive reporting.

Developing performance metrics for governance oversight.

Producing insights to guide decision-making and prioritisation.

Location: Sydney or Melbourne

Type: Fixed Term Contract

Hybrid role, Happy to talk flexible working

Click here to discover what it's like to be a part of QBE Group  




The opportunity

We’re seeking a digitally fluent and human-centred Learning Specialist to join our global leadership development team.  

In this role, you’ll play a key part in partnering closely with stakeholders to ensure that all leadership development experiences created by our global team to be delivered across our diverse regions are accessible and consistent. By leveraging design thinking and inclusive practices, you'll design and deliver playbooks, toolkits, and step-by-step guides that help regional teams localise, scale, package and deliver enterprise learning content for leaders. 




Your new role

You will create thoughtfully crafted playbooks, instructional guides, and communications that are not only easy to navigate but also tailored to resonate with diverse regional audiences. Your work will ensure that leadership experiences are consistent, scalable, and aligned with both global standards and local needs.

Design and develop a range of toolkits and step-by-step guides that support leadership development professionals across our regions to deliver centrally developed impactful learning experiences.

Maintain consistency in tone, structure, and branding across all communications and instructional assets to reinforce a unified leadership development identity.

Collaborate with global stakeholders to ensure all materials are contextually relevant, culturally attuned, and aligned with regional business needs.

Apply design thinking and human-centred design principles to the creation and delivery of content, ensuring it is engaging, inclusive, and accessible.

Continuously enhance learning products by incorporating feedback, monitoring usage, and adapting to evolving organisational priorities.

Lead the evaluation and measurement of global leadership development experiences, synthesising data and insights to inform ongoing improvements.

Oversee the administration of global leadership assessments, ensuring smooth execution, accurate reporting, and alignment with broader capability strategies.




About you

To be successful you will bring strong instructional design skills with a focus on adult learning and leadership development. Known for simplifying complex ideas, you create clear, user-friendly content and collaborate effectively across teams and regions.

Advanced PowerPoint skills with expertise in visual storytelling, template creation, and graphic design using tools like Canva, Adobe Illustrator, or Photoshop.

Proficient in video editing using Adobe Premiere Pro, Camtasia, or Final Cut Pro to produce engaging instructional content.

Experienced in managing instructional assets through platforms like SharePoint and Confluence, ensuring consistency in tone, structure, and branding.

Skilled in plain language writing and instructional editing, with strong proficiency in Microsoft Teams, Miro, and other collaborative tools.




About QBE

We can never really predict what’s around the corner, but at QBE we’re asking the right questions to enable a more resilient future – helping those around us build strength and embrace change to their advantage. We’re an international insurer that’s building momentum towards realising our vision of becoming the most consistent and innovative risk partner.

And our people will be at the centre of our success. We’re proud to work together, and encourage each other enable resilience for our customers, our environment, our economies and our communities. With more than more than 13,000 people working across 27 countries, we’re big enough to make a real impact, but small enough to provide a friendly workplace, where people are down-to-earth, passionate and kind.

We believe this is our moment – what if it was yours too? Your career at QBE — let’s make it happen!

A range of discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services

Platinum employer on the Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI) – the definitive national benchmark on LGBTQI+ workplace inclusion

Ranked in the top ten in the AAGE Top Graduate Employers 2025 for medium sized program as voted by graduates

Family Friendly Workplace accredited employer since 2021

Senior Growth Product Manager | Fast-Growing Consumer Scaleup Sydney-based | Hybrid | Permanent Role

Growth Product Manager We’re looking for a Growth Product Manager to join a fast-growing, well-funded consumer scale-up that’s reshaping its industry. With over 100,000 active customers, $200M+ in annual revenue, and a valuation heading toward unicorn status, this is a chance to join a company at a pivotal point in its journey. ARR more than doubled last year, and the business is on track for another 60% growth in 2025 - now’s the time to help accelerate that trajectory.

This role is ideal for someone who loves diving deep into data, uncovering insights that shape strategy, and running structured experiments that drive measurable results. You’ll operate at the intersection of product, marketing, data, and design, helping to uncover what truly moves the needle for customers and the business.

What You’ll Be Doing
Own the growth roadmap: Build and execute a clear, prioritised plan across acquisition, activation, conversion and retention.
Lead experimentation: Design and run data-informed experiments at scale, testing hypotheses that influence the customer journey and revenue levers.
Turn insights into strategy: Use data, customer research, and behavioural signals to identify and prioritise high-impact growth opportunities.
Collaborate cross-functionally: Partner with design, engineering, and analytics to deliver fast, evidence-based iterations that improve key metrics.
Balance short-term and long-term impact: Deliver quick wins through testing and optimisation, while shaping the long-term strategy for sustainable growth.
Report on performance: Translate results into actionable insights and communicate clearly with senior stakeholders.
What You’ll Bring
5+ years’ experience in product management or growth within a fast-moving consumer or subscription-based business.
Proven success driving conversion rate improvements, funnel optimisation, and customer retention through experimentation.
A strong analytical mindset, with hands-on experience in data analysis and experimentation tools (SQL, Looker, Amplitude, GA4, etc.).
Commercial acumen - able to connect product decisions to revenue, margin, and customer lifetime value.
Customer empathy - you think deeply about user motivations and behaviours, not just metrics.
Fluency in growth frameworks (AARRR, ICE, Effort/Impact, Opportunity Solution Tree) and comfort with ambiguity.
Strong communication skills - able to distil complex ideas into clear narratives and influence across teams.
Who You Are
A structured thinker who can quickly break down complex problems.
Hands-on and curious - you love running discovery and getting close to the data.
Balanced - you can deliver quick, tactical experiments but also step back to see the strategic picture.
Collaborative - you bring teams along with you, ensuring alignment from concept to execution.
Motivated by impact - you’re driven by seeing your ideas translate into real business and customer outcomes.
Why You’ll Love It

You’ll join a profitable, product-led scaleup that’s transforming its category through data, experimentation and a deep understanding of its customers.
You’ll have genuine ownership, a talented cross-functional team to partner with, and the opportunity to define how growth happens - not just react to it.

Location: Sydney (hybrid, 2–3 days in office)
Salary: Competitive base + super + potential ESOP

Established in 2022, OneDigital brings together Wesfarmers’ digitally native businesses, including the OnePass membership program and the Group data asset. We’re the engine behind Wesfarmers’ data and digital transformation, turning millions of customer interactions into game-changing insights that shape how Australians shop, live and connect.

Joining Wesfarmers OneDigital means you’ll:

Work with some of Australia’s most iconic brands and be part of one of the country’s largest and most respected employers, known for its steady growth and strong performance.
Belong to a genuinely supportive team—a group of down-to-earth people who value integrity, openness, accountability and entrepreneurial spirit.
Grow your career with confidence, backed by development opportunities and long-term progression across the broader Wesfarmers Group.
Contribute to something bigger, with a company globally recognised for its commitment to sustainability.
Be part of a future-focused digital ecosystem, with significant investment in data, technology, and customer experience innovation.

To learn more - here is a bit about the Wesfarmers Way and our Values: The Wesfarmers Way.

So, want to help reshape the future of retail? Good call. Join us and create smarter, more rewarding experiences for millions of Australians, one insight at a time.

Your Role

As a Lead Data Scientist in OneData, you’ll contribute to the strategic direction of our data science capability, with GenAI as a core pillar. Reporting to the Advanced Analytics Manager, you’ll lead a high-performing team, drive enterprise-wide AI adoption, and deliver transformational outcomes through deep technical expertise and strong leadership.

What you’ll be doing

Define and drive the data science strategy aligned with business goals
Build and lead a team with strong GenAI capabilities
Establish best practices for ML and GenAI across the organisation
Oversee the full AI lifecycle, ensuring scalability and reliability
Champion responsible AI practices including safety and governance
Partner with senior stakeholders to identify high-impact opportunities
Manage vendor relationships and represent data science in strategic forums
Stay ahead of emerging AI technologies and foster a culture of innovation

What you’ll bring

8+ years in data science, with 3+ years in leadership roles
Advanced degree (Master’s/PhD) in a relevant field
Proven success in building and scaling data science teams
Expert-level proficiency in Python, SQL, and cloud platforms
Strong business acumen and stakeholder management skills
Experience with ML/AI operations, governance, and production systems
Budget or P&L management experience

Nice to have

Experience in retail or centralised data teams
Deep expertise in GenAI strategy and enterprise transformation
Knowledge of LLM architectures, fine-tuning, and deployment
Familiarity with Snowflake, Anyscale, Weights & Biases
Understanding of AI governance and compliance frameworks
Strong network in the data science and GenAI communities

Tech stack

Snowflake, SQL, Python, PowerBI
GenAI tools (LLMs, prompt engineering, RAG, governance frameworks)
Anyscale, Weights & Biases

Key Team Member Benefits

To support you at work, what you value in life and in the community, our team member benefits include:

Competitive remuneration and participation in our annual incentive programs
Fantastic career and development opportunities within your role and across a diverse range of businesses within the Group
Convenient city location
Modern and spacious end of trip facilities
Supported Learning opportunities
Paid primary carer parental leave (16 weeks) and non-primary carer parental leave (4 weeks)
Paid leave to volunteer within the community
Hybrid working – we balance working together with working flexibly
A team member discount card and discounts across a range of businesses – including Bunnings, Kmart, Target, Officeworks, Clearskin Care and Kleenheat Gas
Free OnePass membership

 

Next steps

If this sounds like your next career move, then click on the ‘Apply’ button now! Please note that we may commence interviewing candidates prior to the application closing date.

ServiceNow Elite Partner - all onshore work - good work/life balance

Multiple customers across both private and public sectors

About the company
  
At AC3, our purpose is to make technology real, and as the leaders in secure multi-cloud solutions, we get to do this for our customers every day. We are an Australian owned IT Services Company, with offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Auckland, servicing over 50% of the NSW State Government and over 1,200 enterprise customers in Australia & NZ.
  
Our expertise:

Cloud and infrastructure
Cyber security
Software and data integration
ServiceNow
  
We’re a company that believes in doing the right thing by our customers and each other, and delivering on our promises. Beyond getting to work with cool tech and cool clients, you’ll also find real recognition and flexible work that works for you.


About the role

Our ServiceNow practice successfully won major programs of work and we're growing the team!
We are on the lookout for a solid ServiceNow BA to join the team and work closely with our customers across various industries.

Some of your key responsibilities will be to: 

Contribute to the analysis and delivery of business process initiatives
Organise and facilitate workshops with customers - Meeting with user groups to gather and analyse end user requirements as required.
Create process maps and identify areas for potential improvement.
Provide sound operational and solution options either independently or jointly with Solution Architecture/Lead Engineering.
Develop functional specifications and document desired outcome of system enhancement/development.
Produce technical specifications to communicate user requirements in technical terms to stakeholders.
Coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure the overall efficiency, functionality and user friendliness of system enhancements.
Provide input directly into operational change management initiatives and training.
Provide subject matter knowledge on ServiceNow or other relevant Product capability for our customers during engagements.
Demonstrate detailed knowledge of products through the ability to accurately explain core system functionality, module
capability and configuration options.

Skills & Experience

3+ years’ experience in a business analysis role 
Proven ability to work on large scale transformation in the Public Sector or large commercial enterprise.
Strong knowledge across ServiceNow platform and modules such as ITSM, CMDB, ITOM, HRSD, LSD.
Experience in contributing to organisational change management efforts
Outstanding ability to analyse, isolate and interpret business needs and develop appropriate artefacts/outputs.
Proven ability to adapt and work under pressure in a complex
environment with multiple stakeholders and firm deadlines.
Industry certifications such as ServiceNow Certified System Admin (CSA) and ITIL Foundation certificate
Outstanding level of written and oral communications skills, with a confident, personable and professional manner.

Benefits
  

Exciting time to join an expanding Multi Cloud Solutions Provider and ServiceNow Elite Partner with excellent reputation
Varied engagements, environments and clients (corporate and government)
Work with some of the brightest minds in the Industry
Genuine flexible work environment (WFH & Office)
Strong investment in training and upskilling - certifications paid for
Mature team environment with a high level of engagement
Location: SYDNEY or MELBOURNE or BRISBANE
Facilities for socialising and relaxing
Lots of company social events
"Me Days" ~ equivalent to 1 extra week of annual leave
$110-$115,000 + super + bonus + benefits
  
Culture

People here have real relationships that go beyond work, and maintaining our awesome culture is a top priority at AC3. We believe it’s important that everyone is heard and treated with respect, whether you have the next big idea or simply a question. We keep it real and live by the AC3 way. The 3 simple elements of the AC3 Way are:

Work Wise– As one AC3, we put our combined skills to work to ensure we do more good, for much less. All in service of our customers and each other.
Work Humble– As a team, we bring our authentic selves to the world of tech. It’s our down-to-earth, humble nature that makes us unique and easy to work with.
Work Honest– We’re here to do an honest day’s work, individually and as a team. We’re constantly looking for opportunities to take the initiative and implement practical solutions.
We’d love for you to experience the AC3 way for yourself!

Business Analyst – Defence ERP Projects

Location: Canberra
Clearance: Baseline (NV1 highly regarded)
Work Type: Full-time

About the Opportunity

Blooming People is proud to represent a boutique consulting agency specialising in Defence transformation projects. We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst Consultant to support the Department of Defence’s ERP program within CASG’s Commercial Division.

This is a rare opportunity to contribute to one of Australia’s most significant ERP transformation programs, driving process improvement, digital enablement, and business readiness across the Procure to Pay value chain in SAP S/4HANA.

What You’ll Do

In this role, you will:

Deliver high-quality business analysis services that align Defence requirements with operational and system processes.

Analyse, prepare, and validate requirements with solution design, testing, and ERP/S4HANA implementation.

Develop artefacts and process maps to articulate current and future state business processes.

Provide technical expertise for data migration, reconciliation, and the Procure to Pay business solution.

Lead and support stakeholder workshops, manage UAT/PVT activities, and champion process improvement.

Work with cross-functional project teams, SMEs, and Defence stakeholders to ensure effective adoption of new processes and systems.

What We’re Looking For

We want to hear from you if you bring:

4+ years’ experience delivering business analysis in complex IT and/or Defence environments.

Strong knowledge of SAP S/4HANA and familiarity with ServiceNow.

Certification or practical knowledge in Agile, BABOK, IIBA, or Six Sigma.

Outstanding communication and facilitation skills, with the ability to engage stakeholders and translate complex requirements into actionable solutions.

Existing Baseline security clearance (essential); NV1 clearance preferred.

Why Join Us?

This is more than a role – it’s a chance to:

Play a critical role in Defence’s ERP transformation journey.

Work with a boutique Defence-focused consultancy that values honesty, integrity, and collaboration.

Join a high-performing, close-knit consulting team that partners directly with Defence.

Develop your skills in a fast-paced, high-profile ERP environment.

How to Apply

If you’re passionate about Defence transformation and have the skills to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you.

Apply now through Seek or reach out to Blooming People to discuss how you can be part of this Defence consulting opportunity.
